reasoning: The screenshot shows an actual error dialog with message 'Another user has taken action on the page and its state has been changed' when attempting to discard content. The API endpoint returns a 500 server error, indicating a real server-side state synchronization bug.
evidence_summary: Screenshot shows the Evoq page editor with a visible error modal dialog appearing after clicking Discard. The [DRAFT TEST] content is visible, confirming draft content exists. The Discard button is present in the toolbar, but clicking it triggers a server error (500) rather than successfully discarding the draft changes.
